Certainly! Here's your balanced, nutritious meal plan to start off with:

**Breakfast – Overnight Chia Pudding:**
- 3 tablespoons of chia seeds (soaked in almond milk overnight)
- A handful of fresh berries for added antioxidants and flavor
- Sliced banana to add natural sweetness without sugar
- Optional sprinkle of cinnamon or a drizzle of honey if desired 

**Lunch – Grilled Chicken Salad:**
- A lean, skinless chicken breast grilled with herbs (like rosemary and thyme) for flavor.
- Mixed greens as the base including spinach, arugula, and romaine lettuce 
- Sliced avocado to add healthy fats and fiber; also rich in potassium which aids muscle function during your workouts later today
- Cherry tomatoes for vitamins C & K as well as lycopene (which is good for heart health)
- A small portion of crumbled goat cheese or nuts like walnuts/almonds to add protein and calcium 
- Dress the salad with a simple vinaigrette made from extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt, pepper (and garlic if you enjoy it) for taste without added sugars or unhealthy fats. 

**Dinner – Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Steamed Broccoli:**
- A serving of wild-caught salmon fillet to provide Omega-3 fatty acids, which are great for heart health and reducing inflammation in the body (you might consider having a side portion if you're trying to increase your protein intake). 
- Half cup cooked quinoa as an excellent source of plant proteins; this will also help keep blood sugar levels stable throughout the day. Add some lemon juice or zest over top before serving for added flavor without extra calories/sodium content (the acid in lemons can aid digestion).
- Steamed broccoli florets sprinkled with a bit of sea salt to add fiber, vitamins A and C – essential antioxidants that support immune function while keeping your body energized through the day. 

**Snacks:**
If you find yourself getting hungry between meals or if there's any room left in this plan for an additional snack, consider one of these options:  
- A handful (28 grams) unsalted almonds/walnut halves which offer a good balance of healthy fats and protein to keep you full until the next meal; try not going over 150 calories per serving for your snack. You could also pair this with dried cranberries or raisins if desired as they provide extra fiber without added sugars like those found in many commercial granola bars/snacks (plus vitamin C).
- An apple sliced into wedges; apples are excellent sources of dietary fiber which can help regulate bowel movements and keep you feeling full for longer periods. The pectin contained within them also has prebiotic properties that promote healthy gut bacteria growth (good digestion).
- A cup or two serving size green tea, caffeine free if needed; drinking water throughout the day is key to maintain proper hydration levels too – so try adding some fresh lemon/lime slices in there as well! 

This balanced and nutritious meal plan will help fuel your body with healthy ingredients that are rich in vitamins, minerals, protein & fiber while keeping blood sugar levels stable throughout the day for optimal energy production. Remember - listen closely to how you feel after consuming certain foods/drinks (and adjust accordingly) as everyone's metabolism respond differently depending on their unique genetic makeup or lifestyle factors such as exercise routines, stress level etc.. 

Enjoy your healthy eating journey! If there are any changes needed based upon feedback from this plan - let me know and we can adjust accordingly. Remember: a balanced diet coupled with regular physical activity is one of the most important factors in maintaining overall well-being & feeling energized throughout each day, so keep up your good habits!
